brief_description: T cell human Immune Signature of Zika infection was studied
brief_title: Human Immune Signature of Zika virus infection
description: The human Immune Signature of Zika virus infection was studied in a Zika endemic area, Brazil. T cell responses were compared in acute infected patients as well as convalescent patients.
endpoints: Compare T cell response of acute and convalescent Zika virus infected patients by flow cytometry and RNA sequencing
hypothesis: Compare T cell response of acute versus convalescent Zika virus infected patients
objectives: To determine the T cell immune signature of Zika virus infection
official_title: Phenotyping and mRNA profiling of Zika virus-specific CD4 and CD8 T cells

arm.description: Patients with an acute Zika virus infection living in a Zika endemic area such as Brazil
arm.name: Acute Zika virus infected patients

arm.description: Patients who had an acute Zika virus infection and are now at least 2 weeks post-infection that were infected in an endemic area
arm.name: Convalescent Zika virus infected patients

arm.description: Individuals from a Zika endemic areas, such as Brazil, who have not been infected with Zika virus
arm.name: Non-Zika virus infected individuals from a Zika endemic area

personnel.organization: La Jolla Institute for Allergy and Immunology
personnel.site_name: La Jolla Institute for Allergy and Immunology

program.contract_name: Human immune signatures of dengue virus and mycobacterium tuberculosis exposure in infection; disease and vaccination (La Jolla)
